Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]

Name: ImonAnt.snicefreez
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Field 12: Mass flux of surface meltwater which refreezes within the snowpack. Computed as the total refreezing on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Omon.msftmrhompa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 11: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 12: CMIP5 called this 'due to Bolus Advection'.  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations. [Function of latitude, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyrhompa), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section (on density surfaces) [YB-R] [bzzsum]

Name: Emon.nLitterSubSurf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)
Field 11: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)
Field 12: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Subsurface litter' means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Name: CFsubhr.rtmt
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Field 11: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Field 12: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Eday.mrros
Field 12: surface_runoff_flux

Name: Emon.opottemprmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 12: The phrase 'residual mean advection' refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E3hrPt.aerasymbnd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Aerosol Level Asymmetry Parameter for Each Band
Field 11: Aerosol Level Asymmetry Parameter for Each Band
Field 12: The asymmetry factor is the angular integral of the aerosol scattering phase function weighted by the cosine of the angle with the incident radiation flux. The asymmetry coefficient is here an integral over all wavelength bands.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] {spectband:} [tpt]

Field 12: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Name: AERmon.o3loss
Field 12: ONLY provide the sum of the following reactions: (i) O(1D)+H2O; (ii) O3+HO2; (iii) O3+OH; (iv) O3+alkenes (isoprene, ethene,...)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: EmonZ.zmtnt
Field 12: The diabatic heating rates due to all the processes that may change potential temperature
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: day.tasmax
Field 12: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max') [normally report this at 2 meters above the surface]

Name: Amon.sci
Title (from Variables (Import)): Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Field 11: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Field 12: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell. [For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme only.]

Name: Omon.dissi14cabioos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Field 11: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Field 12: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic 14carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: Omon.tauuo
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Field 11: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Field 12: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc. [Report on native horizontal grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] [tmean] (optionally on vertices)

Name: AERmon.pfull
Field 12: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer midpoints for all times and levels in the associated output variables
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: SImon.snmassacrossline
Field 12: Flux across 4 straits

Name: Omon.msftyrho
Field 12: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized. [Function of Y, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmrho) and should in this case be omitted. ]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section (on density surfaces) [YB-R] [bgzmean]

Name: Oclim.tnpeo
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content
Field 11: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content
Field 12: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: Omon.limncalc
Field 12: 'Calcareous phytoplankton' are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: CFday.pfull
Field 12: Air pressure on model levels [This field is needed only for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmonZ.h2o
Field 12: includes all phases of water
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Oday.sossq
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.  [Report on the ocean horizontal native grid.]

Name: Emon.nLitterCwd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Field 11: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Field 12: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Wood debris' means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Name: Lmon.burntFractionAll
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
Field 11: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
Field 12: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change [Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: Omon.hfbasinpadv
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: Eday.qgwr
Field 12: water_flux_from_soil_layer_to_groundwater

Name: 6hrPlevPt.mrsos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Field 11: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Field 12: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:sdepth1} [amnla-tpt]

Name: ImonAnt.mrroLi
Field 12: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: SImon.siflcondbot
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Conductive Heat Fluxes in Ice at the Bottom
Field 11: Net Conductive Heat Fluxes in Ice at the Bottom
Field 12: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base

Name: Omon.prra
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rainfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Field 11: Rainfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Field 12: computed as the total mass of liquid water falling as liquid rain  into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. [Report on native horizontal grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (ice free sea) [XY-na] [amnifs-tmn]

Name: Amon.tos
Field 12: na

Name: ImonAnt.hfls
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: AERday.maxpblz
Field 12: maximum boundary layer height during the day (add cell_methods attribute: 'time: maximum')

Name: Ofx.areacello
Field 12: Cell areas for any grid used to report ocean variables and variables which are requested as used on the model ocean grid (e.g. hfsso, which is a downward heat flux from the atmosphere interpolated onto the ocean grid). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere). [For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level, area sum) [XY-na]

Name: AERmon.oh
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: SImon.sifllwutop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Field 11: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Field 12: the upwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

Name: Oyr.opottemptend
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: EmonZ.vtendnogw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 11: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 12: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: fx.zfull
Field 12: Provide only if altitude of full model levels is fixed

Name: EmonZ.vtem
Field 12: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics v*, meridional component of the residual meridional circulation (v*, w*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Eyr.cropFrac
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

Name: Oclim.diftrxylo
Field 12: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. 'xy diffusivity' means the lateral along_coordinate component of diffusivity due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model.  xy diffusivities are used in some ocean models to counteract the numerical instabilities inherent in certain implementations of rotated neutral diffusion. 'laplacian diffusivity' means diffusivity for use with a Laplacian diffusion operator. [3-d time dependent field]
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: Omon.sfriver
Title (from Variables (Import)): Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Field 11: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Field 12: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.]

Name: day.hur
Field 12: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (8 pressure levels) [XY-P8] [tmean]

Name: ImonGre.prra
Field 12: over Land Ice//quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Oyr.pbsi
Field 12: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFday.cltcalipso
Field 12: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: ImonGre.tas
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Name: Lmon.fGrazing
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Grazing on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Grazing on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to grazing on land

Name: Omon.limirrdiat
Field 12: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: SImon.sithick
Field 12: (in OImon, sit was volume per entire cell area)

Name: Omon.po4
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Dissolved inorganic phosphorus' means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid). [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Amon.tasmax
Field 12: monthly mean of the daily-maximum near-surface air temperature. [normally, this should be reported at the 2 meter height.]

Name: CFsubhr.rsdcs
Field 12: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere) [Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: day.hurs
Field 12: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C. [normally report this at 2 meters above the surface]

Name: Eday.sblnosn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sublimation of the Snow Free Area
Field 11: Sublimation of the Snow Free Area
Field 12: sublimation_amount_assuming_no_snow

Name: Efx.siltfrac
Field 12: Volume fraction of silt in soil
Field 13: Time Invariant Global Field on Soil Levels [XY-na] {sdepth:} [amla]

Name: AERmon.rssaf
Field 12: na

Name: EmonZ.wtem
Field 12: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics w*, upward component of the residual meridional circulation (v*, w*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Scale height: 6950 m
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Odec.thkcello
Field 12: 'Thickness' means the vertical extent of a layer. 'Cell' refers to a model grid-cell. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CF3hr.pfull
Field 12: Air pressure on model levels [provide this field for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: day.pr
Field 12: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

Name: CF3hr.prlsns
Field 12: large-scale precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase. [report on model half-levels]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [amn-tpt]

Name: CFsubhr.tauu
Field 12: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: AERmon.emianox
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic NOx
Field 11: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic NOx
Field 12: Store flux as Nitrogen. Anthropogenic fraction. NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: Omon.zmicro
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.prsn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Snowfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Field 11: Snowfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Field 12: computed as the total mass per unit time of solid-phase precipitation falling into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.   (Snowfall flux includes all types of solid-phase precipitation.) [Report on native horizontal grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (ice free sea) [XY-na] [amnifs-tmn]

Name: Emon.ocontemppmdiff
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.emiisop
Field 12: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

Name: Oyr.osaltpsmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 12: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.mfoindo
Field 12: na

Name: CF3hr.tauv
Field 12: Downward northward wind stress at the surface
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.ficeberg2d
Title (from Variables (Import)): Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Field 11: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Field 12: computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. [If only the vertically integrated melt water flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise ficeberg should be used.]

Name: Eyr.fracOutLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles
Field 11: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles
Field 12: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Name: Omon.co3os
Field 12: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

Name: Emon.expfe
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Ofx.volcello
Field 12: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields [a 3-d field: For oceans with more than 1 mesh, report on grid that applies to temperature]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [asum-fx]

Name: Odec.thetaoga
Title (from Variables (Import)): Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature
Field 11: Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature
Field 12: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field [Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C]

Name: Lmon.cLitterAbove
Field 12: 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Surface litter' means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

Name: CFsubhr.tnhus
Field 12: Tendency of Specific Humidity
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Emon.clwvic
Field 12: Convective Condensed Water Path

Name: AERmon.toz
Field 12: total ozone column in DU

Name: Omon.spco2nat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Natural Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Field 11: Natural Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, a 'natural analogue' is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

Name: Emon.c13Soil
Field 12: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in soil.

Name: Omon.msftmzmpa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 11: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 12: CMIP5 called this 'due to Bolus Advection'.  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations. [Function of latitude, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyzmpa), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section [YB-O] [bzzsum]

Name: Omon.frn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification
Field 11: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification
Field 12: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.

Name: SImon.simass
Field 12: (in OImon, sim included snow and sea ice mass)

Name: Omon.soga
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Name: Amon.utendepfd
Field 12: na

Name: AERmonZ.cly
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio
Field 11: Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio
Field 12: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Omon.co3
Field 12: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3). [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.tnkebto
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements. [Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: Eday.mrlqso
Title (from Variables (Import)): Average Layer Fraction of Liquid Moisture
Field 11: Average Layer Fraction of Liquid Moisture
Field 12: mass_fraction_of_unfrozen_water_in_soil_layer
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on soil levels [XY-S] [amnla-tmn]

Name: SImon.sidmasstranx
Field 12: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {on model mesh points} [tmean]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction). [on the following pressure levels: 850, 500, 250 hPa]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (3 pressure levels) [XY-P3] [amn-tpt]

Name: SImon.siconc
Field 12: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice
Field 13: Temporal weighted mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:typesi} [amse-tmn]

Name: EmonZ.sltnortha
Field 12: na

Name: CFmon.clwc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Field 12: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Eday.albc
Field 12: Canopy Albedo

Name: Omon.aragos
Field 12: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Name: SImon.sistryubot
Title (from Variables (Import)): Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Field 11: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Field 12: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

Name: Emon.cWood
Field 12: Carbon Mass in Wood

Name: Eday.loadsoa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Field 11: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Field 12: The total dry mass of secondary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

Name: CFday.clcalipso
Field 12: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers. [40 levels]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on 40 altitude levels [XY-H40] [tmean]

Name: Emon.ppdiat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Field 11: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Field 12: Primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: LImon.pflw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
Field 11: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
Field 12: 'where land over land', i.e., this is the total mass of liquid water contained within the permafrost layer within the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

Name: AERmon.wetdust
Field 12: Surface deposition rate of dust (dry mass) due to wet processes

Name: AERmon.no
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Oday.tos
Field 12: This may differ from 'surface temperature' in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature. [Report on the ocean horizontal native grid.]

Name: Omon.hfbasinpsmadv
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 11: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 12: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: Emon.fDeforestToAtmos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Name: Oyr.chlmisc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.co3
Field 12: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: EdayZ.hus
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 19 pressure levels) [Y-P19] [tmean]

Name: Emon.hussLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Near-Surface Specific Humidity on Land-Use Tile
Field 11: Near-Surface Specific Humidity on Land-Use Tile
Field 12: Normally, the specific humidity should be reported at the 2 meter height

Name: Eday.tauvpbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
Field 11: Northward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
Field 12: surface

Name: Emon.gppc14
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ('producers') expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Name: Lmon.baresoilFrac
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil. [Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: Eday.prveg
Field 12: precipitation_flux_onto_canopy

Name: Eday.dtesn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Change in Snow and Ice Cold Content
Field 11: Change in Snow and Ice Cold Content

Name: Eday.t20d
Field 12: This quantity, sometimes called the 'isotherm depth', is the depth (if it exists) at which the sea water potential temperature equals some specified value. This value should be specified in a scalar coordinate variable. Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.

Name: day.hus
Field 12: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (8 pressure levels) [XY-P8] [tmean]

Name: E6hrZ.zmswaero
Title (from Variables (Import)): Zonal Mean Shortwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Field 11: Zonal Mean Shortwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Field 12: shortwave heating rate due to volcanic aerosols to be diagnosed through double radiation call, zonal average values required
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Zonal mean (on model levels) [Y-A] [tpt]

Name: Emon.tntrs
Field 12: na

Name: AERmon.mmrno3
Field 12: Dry mass fraction of nitrate aerosol particles in air.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Omon.ppos
Field 12: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]

Name: Emon.raLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.

Name: Emon.rsdoabsorb
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer
Field 11: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer
Field 12: 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. 'Layer' means any layer with upper and lower boundaries that have constant values in some vertical coordinate. There must be a vertical coordinate variable indicating the extent of the layer(s). If the layers are model layers, the vertical coordinate can be model_level_number, but it is recommended to specify a physical coordinate (in a scalar or auxiliary coordinate variable) as well. Net absorbed radiation is the difference between absorbed and emitted radiation.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.jpdftaureicemodis
Title (from Variables (Import)): MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Field 11: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Field 12: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, ice

Name: LImon.rlusIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Oday.tossq
Field 12: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day. [Report on the ocean horizontal native grid.]

Name: EmonZ.tntnogw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Temperature Tendency Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Dissipation
Field 11: Temperature Tendency Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Dissipation
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: EdayZ.zg
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 19 pressure levels) [Y-P19] [tmean]

Name: E3hrPt.albdirbnd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Direct Surface Albedo for Each Band
Field 11: Direct Surface Albedo for Each Band
Field 12: The fraction of the surface direct downwelling shortwave radiation flux which is reflected. It is equivalent to the surface bidirectional reflectance at the incident angle of the incoming solar radiation and integrated over all outgoing angles in the hemisphere above the surface.  Reported in spectral frequency bands.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {spectband:} [tpt]

Name: CF3hr.clwc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Field 12: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Eday.tsland
Field 12: Surface temperature on land

Name: 3hr.tslsi
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
Field 11: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
Field 12: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.

Name: Eyr.treeFrac
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

Name: Amon.cli
Field 12: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model. [Report on model layers (not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CFday.clmcalipso
Title (from Variables (Import)): CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Field 11: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Field 12: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

Name: SImon.siarean
Field 12: total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

Name: CFmon.mcd
Field 12: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud). [Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: Emon.uv
Title (from Variables (Import)): Product of Eastward Wind and Northward Wind
Field 11: Product of Eastward Wind and Northward Wind
Field 12: u*v
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.evspsblpot
Field 12: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Name: SImon.siforcetiltx
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Field 11: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Field 12: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt
Field 13: Time  mean, weighted by sea ice area, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {on model mest points} [amnsi-twm]

Name: SImon.sidmasssi
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Field 11: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Field 12: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Name: Omon.detoc
Field 12: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.sconcdust
Field 12: mass concentration of dust dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

Name: CF3hr.rtmt
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Field 11: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Field 12: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: day.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (8 pressure levels) [XY-P8] [tmean]

Name: Eyr.cSoilLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles
Field 11: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles
Field 12: end of year values (not annual mean)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {landUse:}

Name: Eday.evspsbl
Field 12: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Name: LImon.litemptopIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Field 11: Ice Sheet Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Oyr.dissicabio
Field 12: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.treeFracNdlEvg
Field 12: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf evergreen trees.

Name: Oyr.sf6
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: IyrGre.litemptop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Field 11: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: EmonZ.epfz
Title (from Variables (Import)): Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Field 11: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Omon.fddtdisi
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Silicon
Field 11: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Silicon
Field 12: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicon [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: Emon.fbddtdic
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.vwap
Title (from Variables (Import)): Product of Northward Wind and Omega
Field 11: Product of Northward Wind and Omega
Field 12: v*omega
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Lmon.npp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: 'Production of carbon' means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ('producers'), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. 'Productivity' means production per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. [needed for any model that does not compute GPP]

Name: CF3hr.rldscs
Field 12: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.pon
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFday.ta
Field 12: Air Temperature
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.expcalc
Field 12: Downward flux of Calcite [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.hfss
Field 12: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: AERhr.sfpm25
Title (from Variables (Import)): PM2.5 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 11: PM2.5 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 12: Mass fraction of atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers. To specify the relative humidity and temperature at which the particle size applies, provide scalar coordinate variables with the standard names of 'relative_humidity' and 'air_temperature'.

Name: day.hursmin
Field 12: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C. [normally report this at 2 meters above the surface]

Name: ImonAnt.snc
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Oyr.difvso
Field 12: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.cLitterGrass
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Litter on Grass Tiles
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Litter on Grass Tiles
Field 12: 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

Name: 6hrPlev.ta
Field 12: na

Name: Oyr.pp
Field 12: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.cldnvi
Field 12: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

Name: Emon.grassFracC3
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.

Name: SIday.siu
Field 12: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid
Field 13: Time  mean, weighted by sea ice area, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {on model mest points} [amnsi-twm]

Name: Eday.ec
Field 12: liquid_water_evaporation_flux_from_canopy

Name: CF3hr.prsn
Field 12: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.phyp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton phosphorus components
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: 3hr.tas
Field 12: This is sampled synoptically. [normally, report at 2 meters above the surface]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:height2m} [tpt]

Name: CF3hr.phalf
Field 12: Air pressure on model half-levels [provide this field for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.climodis
Field 12: MODIS Ice Cloud Fraction

Name: CFsubhr.vas
Field 12: Northward component of the near surface wind [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (specific locations requested by CFMIP) [S-na] {:height10m} [apt-tpt]

Name: Emon.rss
Field 12: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

Name: AERmon.wetnh4
Field 12: Surface deposition rate of ammonium (NH4) due to wet processes

Name: CFday.phalf
Field 12: Air pressure on model half-levels [This field is needed only for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: CFmon.cls
Field 12: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.cLitterShrub
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Litter on Shrub Tiles
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Litter on Shrub Tiles
Field 12: 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

Name: Lmon.tsl
Field 12: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'. [If soil layer thicknesses vary from one location to another, interpolate to a standard set of depths.  Ideally, the interpolation should preserve the vertical integral.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on soil levels [XY-S] [amnla-tmn]

Name: CFmon.clisccp
Field 12: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories. [7 levels x 7 tau]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (7 pressure levels) [XY-P7] {tau:} [tmean]

Name: Omon.hfsifrazil
Title (from Variables (Import)): Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation
Field 11: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Frazil' consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water. [In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.fbddtdife
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: Emon.fNOx
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. 'Nox' means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Name: Amon.n2oglobal
Title (from Variables (Import)): Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Field 11: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Field 12: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O) [For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?]

Name: CFday.albisccp
Field 12: time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see  http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

Name: Omon.hfbasin
Field 12: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: 6hrPlev.hurs
Field 12: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Name: Emon.gppLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ('producers') expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.

Name: SImon.sisali
Field 12: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell

Name: AERmonZ.n2o
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.od550lt1aer
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ambient Fine Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Field 11: Ambient Fine Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Field 12: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  (''ambient'' means ''wetted''). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.

Name: Omon.pr
Field 12: na

Name: day.tws
Field 12: na

Name: Amon.ta
Field 12: Air Temperature
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Emon.nLand
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools
Field 11: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools
Field 12: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: AERmon.so2
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.pathetao
Field 12: The quantity with standard name sea_water_added_potential_temperature is a passive tracer in an ocean model whose surface flux does not come from the atmosphere but is imposed externally upon the simulated climate system. The surface flux is expressed as a heat flux and converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were a heat flux being added to potential temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were potential temperature. The passive tracer is zero in the control climate of the model. The passive tracer records added heat, as described for the CMIP6 FAFMIP experiment (doi:10.5194/gmd-9-3993-2016), following earlier ideas. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.dcw
Field 12: change_over_time_in_canopy_water_amount

Name: Amon.ts
Field 12: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

Name: Emon.fCLandToOcean
Title (from Variables (Import)): Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Field 11: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Field 12: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

Name: Emon.raTree
Title (from Variables (Import)): Autotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Autotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Total RA of trees in the grid cell

Name: Oyr.bddtdife
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Lmon.mrro
Field 12: the total runoff (including 'drainage' through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

Name: AERmon.mmrpm1
Field 12: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 1 micrometers
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Lmon.mrsos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Field 11: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Field 12: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer. [integrate over uppermost 10 cm]

Name: Emon.gppShrub
Title (from Variables (Import)): Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell

Name: Emon.fbddtdin
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.fN2O
Field 12: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

Name: Omon.chldiatos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Name: E3hrPt.wap
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.fNup
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen
Field 11: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen
Field 12: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.

Name: Emon.nProduct
Title (from Variables (Import)): Nitrogen Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Field 11: Nitrogen Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Field 12: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: fx.mrsofc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)
Field 11: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)
Field 12: reported 'where land': divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as 'missing' where the land fraction is 0.
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amla]

Name: Eday.parasolRefl
Field 12: PARASOL Reflectance

Name: Oyr.co3satarag
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.u2
Field 12: u*u
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: 6hrPlev.bldep
Field 12: Boundary layer depth

Name: Omon.pbfe
Field 12: na

Name: Lmon.cLeaf
Field 12: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves. [This field and some of the following may sum to yield some of the more generic carbon pool totals given above.]

Name: EdayZ.utendogw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 11: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Emon.tdps
Field 12: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

Name: AERday.od550aer
Field 12: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute 'wavelength: 550 nm'

Name: Emon.reffclic
Title (from Variables (Import)): Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice
Field 11: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice
Field 12: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.fahLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Anthropogenic Heat Flux Generated from non-Renewable Human Primary Energy Consumption
Field 11: Anthropogenic Heat Flux Generated from non-Renewable Human Primary Energy Consumption
Field 12: Anthropogenic heat flux generated from non-renewable human primary energy consumption, including energy use by vehicles, commercial and residential buildings, industry, and power plants.  Primary energy refers to energy in natural resources, fossil and nonfossil, before conversion into other forms, such as electricity.

Name: Oyr.expcalc
Field 12: Downward flux of Calcite [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: day.snc
Field 12: Percentage of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

Name: Emon.fNLitterSoil
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Field 11: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Name: Omon.epcalc100
Field 12: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate. [at 100 m depth.]

Name: Emon.tomint
Field 12: na

Name: Odec.hfds
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Field 11: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Field 12: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') . [Report on native horizontal grid as well as remapped onto a latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: Amon.rlut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

Name: Eday.mlotst
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Field 11: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Field 12: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

Name: Amon.hurs
Field 12: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C. [express as a percentage.  Normally, the relative humidity  should be reported at the 2 meter height]

Name: SImon.sisnthick
Field 12: (in OImon, snd was volume per entire cell area)

Name: AERmon.od440aer
Field 12: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute 'wavelength: 440 nm'

Name: Emon.cropFracC4
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

Name: EmonZ.tntscp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.cod
Field 12: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. 'Cloud' means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

Name: Emon.ocontemppsmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oclim.dispkevfo
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to Vertical Friction
Field 11: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to Vertical Friction
Field 12: Friction, leading to the dissipation of kinetic energy, arises in ocean models as a result of the viscosity of sea water.  Generally, the  lateral (xy) viscosity is given a large value to maintain the numerical stability of the model.  In contrast, the vertical viscosity is usually much smaller.
