The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: SImon.siitdsnthick
Title (from Variables (Import)): Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Field 11: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Field 12: K=ice depth bands

Name: CFsubhr.clw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Field 12: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: LImon.tsn
Field 12: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as 'missing in regions free of snow on land.

Name: AERmon.od550oa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Field 11: Total Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Field 12: total organic aerosol AOD, comprises all organic aerosols, primary + secondary ; natural + anthropogenic including biomasss burning organic aerosol

Name: Omon.bfe
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CF3hr.rlds
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.phyn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: AERhr.ps
Field 12: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

Name: Emon.mrsoLut
Field 12: 'Water' means water in all phases. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including 'content_of_soil_layer' are used.

Name: 6hrPlevPt.sfcWind
Field 12: near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:height10m} [tpt]

Name: Omon.fbddtalk
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Biological Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Biological Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: Oyr.opottemppsmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E3hrPt.ps
Field 12: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: CFday.cl
Field 12: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: SImon.sndmasssnf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Snow Mass Change Through Snow Fall
Field 11: Snow Mass Change Through Snow Fall
Field 12: mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by sea-ice area

Name: Oyr.ocontemppadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (all forms of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.c13Veg
Field 12: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass).

Name: CF3hr.h2o
Field 12: includes all phases of water
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.cldwatmxrat
Field 12: na

Name: CFsubhr.clwvi
Field 12: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: AERmon.wetss
Title (from Variables (Import)): Wet Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Field 11: Wet Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Field 12: Deposition rate of sea salt aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

Name: Lmon.fHarvest
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Crop Harvesting [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Crop Harvesting [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to crop harvesting

Name: Omon.fddtdip
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus
Field 11: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus
Field 12: vertical integral of net  time rate of change of phosphate [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: SImon.sitempsnic
Field 12: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero

Name: 3hr.prc
Field 12: at surface.  This is a 3-hour mean convective precipitation flux.

Name: Emon.nwdFracLut
Field 12: Percentage of land use tile tile that is non-woody vegetation ( e.g. herbaceous crops)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {landUse: typenwd} [amnlax-tmn]

Name: E3hr.sfcWind
Field 12: Near surface wind speed

Name: Eday.prrc
Field 12: convective_rainfall_flux

Name: Eday.tsnl
Field 12: na

Name: CFday.rsutcs
Field 12: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

Name: 3hr.mrsos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Field 11: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Field 12: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer. [integrate over uppermost 10 cm]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:sdepth1} [amnla-tpt]

Name: Omon.hfy
Field 12: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. [2d field for CMIP6. Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]

Name: Eday.nudgincsm
Title (from Variables (Import)): Nudging Increment of Water in Soil Moisture
Field 11: Nudging Increment of Water in Soil Moisture
Field 12: nudging_increment_in_water_content_of_soil_layer

Name: CFsubhr.tnhusd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
Field 12: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Emon.osaltpadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: 3hr.rsdsdiff
Field 12: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

Name: Omon.friver
Title (from Variables (Import)): Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Field 11: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Field 12: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. [Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: E3hr.gpp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: only requested for DECK HIST, 1980-present

Name: Emon.uwap
Title (from Variables (Import)): Product of Eastward Wind and Omega
Field 11: Product of Eastward Wind and Omega
Field 12: u*omega
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Eyr.fracLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Field 11: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Field 12: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5*0.2 = 0.1)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {landUse:} [amlax-tpt]

Name: CFmon.clmcalipso
Title (from Variables (Import)): CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Field 11: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Field 12: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

Name: SImon.sidmassth
Field 12: Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area

Name: Eday.rzwc
Field 12: water_content_of_root_zone

Name: Omon.limndiaz
Field 12: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: fx.sftgif
Field 12: fraction of grid cell occupied by 'permanent' ice (i.e., glaciers). [For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level) [XY-na]

Name: Eyr.cLitterLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon  in Above and Below-Ground Litter Pools on Land-Use Tiles
Field 11: Carbon  in Above and Below-Ground Litter Pools on Land-Use Tiles
Field 12: end of year values (not annual mean)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {landUse:}

Name: Emon.cSoilPools
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
Field 12: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated

Name: CFmon.tntmp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Field 12: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: day.ts
Field 12: na

Name: 6hrPlevPt.uas
Field 12: Near surface eastward wind
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:height10m} [tpt]

Name: Emon.vegHeightGrass
Field 12: Vegetation height averaged over the grass fraction of a grid cell.

Name: Amon.n2o
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O. [For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?]

Acetone is an organic molecule with the chemical formula CH3CH3CO. The IUPAC name for acetone is propan-2-one. Acetone is a member of the group of organic compounds known as ketones. Name: Omon.spco2abio
Title (from Variables (Import)): Abiotic Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Field 11: Abiotic Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, an 'abiotic analogue' is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

Name: AERmon.c2h6

'Dissolved inorganic silicon' means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-). [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers. Name: CFmon.smc

For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, this is calculated as convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud). [Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).]

Field 12: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon. [3-d field: report on grid that applies to temperature]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [asum-fx]

Field 12: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Field 12: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called 'buoyancy frequency' and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]

Name: Odec.tauvo

Name: Emon.concdust
Field 12: Mass concentration means mass per unit volume and is used in the construction mass_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. Aerosol particles take up ambient water (a process known as hygroscopic growth) depending on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles. 'Dry aerosol particles' means aerosol particles without any water uptake.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Eday.scldncl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
Field 11: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
Field 12: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water

Field 12: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Efx.rld
Field 12: Fluxes are requested at all levels

Name: Lmon.shrubFrac
Field 12: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub. [add scalar coordinate typeshrub and add "shrub" to the CF area type table.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: 3hr.hfls
Field 12: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Name: AERmon.ccn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top
Field 11: Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top
Field 12: proposed name: number_concentration_of_ambient_aerosol_in_air_at_liquid_water_cloud_top

Name: Amon.cfc12global
Title (from Variables (Import)): Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12
Field 11: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

Name: Amon.rldscs
Field 12: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation

Name: Omon.msftyrhompa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 11: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 12: CMIP5 called this 'due to Bolus Advection'.  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations. [Function of Y, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmrhompa) and should in this case be omitted. ]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section (on density surfaces) [YB-R] [bgzmean]

Name: CF3hr.dtaus
Field 12: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: CFmon.tnhusd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
Field 12: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Oyr.ocontemppmdiff
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: SImon.sndmasssubl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
Field 11: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
Field 12: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area

Name: Eyr.shrubFrac
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

Name: Eday.reffcclwtop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Field 11: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Field 12: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Name: 3hr.rlus
Field 12: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Name: ImonGre.snicefreez
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Field 12: Mass flux of surface meltwater which refreezes within the snowpack. Computed as the total refreezing on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: 6hrLev.hus
Field 12: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. [on all model levels]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.fgcfc11
Field 12: gas exchange flux of CFC11

Name: CFday.clw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Field 12: Calculated as the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: SImon.siflsenstop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Field 11: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Field 12: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice

Name: day.rsus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

Name: Omon.intpbsi
Field 12: Vertically integrated biogenic silica production
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: Emon.ec550aer
Field 12: Aerosol Extinction at 550nm
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] {:lambda550nm} [am-tm]

Name: Omon.bigthetaoga
Title (from Variables (Import)): Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Field 11: Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Field 12: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Name: Ofx.areacelli
Field 12: na

Name: 3hr.rsus
Field 12: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Name: CF3hr.rsdscs
Field 12: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.tntrscs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 12: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Omon.tauucorr
Field 12: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc. [If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year. Report on native horizontal grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] [tmean] (optionally on vertices)

Name: Emon.mmrno3
Field 12: NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio

Name: Emon.tntscp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Field 12: The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.tasmaxCrop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Field 11: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Field 12: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')

Name: SImon.sidconcth
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
Field 11: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
Field 12: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes

Name: AERmon.phalf
Field 12: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer interfaces for all times and levels in the associated output variables
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: Oday.uo
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.fDeforestToProduct
Title (from Variables (Import)): Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
Field 11: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
Field 12: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Name: fx.areacella
Title (from Variables (Import)): Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables
Field 11: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables
Field 12: Cell areas for any grid used to report atmospheric variables and any other variable using that grid (e.g., soil moisture content). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere). [For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level, area sum) [XY-na]

Name: CFmon.tntr
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating
Field 12: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CFsubhr.uas
Field 12: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (specific locations requested by CFMIP) [S-na] {:height10m} [apt-tpt]

Name: Omon.vmo
Field 12: Y-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: SImon.siitdconc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea-Ice Area Percentages in Thickness Categories
Field 11: Sea-Ice Area Percentages in Thickness Categories
Field 12: K=ice depth bands

Name: Eday.tcs
Field 12: Vegetation Canopy Temperature

Name: AERmon.od550csaer
Field 12: AOD from the ambient aerosols in clear skies if od550aer is for all-sky (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute 'wavelength: 550 nm'

Name: Esubhr.reffclws
Title (from Variables (Import)): Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Field 11: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Field 12: alevel site time1
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Emon.hflsLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Field 11: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

Name: EdayZ.utendnogw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 11: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: EmonZ.sltbasin
Field 12: function of latitude, basin [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: SImon.siforcecoriolx
Title (from Variables (Import)): Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (X-Component)

Field 12: X-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

Name: day.prsn
Field 12: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

Name: E3hrPt.clisccp

Field 13: Instantaneous values, Global field (7 pressure levels) [XY-P7] {tau:} [tpt]

Name: Omon.o2os
Field 12: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

Name: AERmon.no2
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERday.ua10
Field 12: Zonal wind on the 10 hPa surface

Name: AERmon.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Eday.ua
Field 12: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.emidms
Field 12: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: Omon.zsatarag
Field 12: Depth of aragonite saturation horizon (0 if < surface, 'missing'  if > bottom, if two, then the shallower)

Name: Lmon.nppLeaf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP

Name: CFsubhr.tauv
Field 12: Downward northward wind stress at the surface [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Oyr.expn
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.osalttend
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content
Field 12: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from all processes.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CF3hr.clic
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Field 12: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.phymisc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.rsdscsdiff
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
Field 11: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
Field 12: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions

Name: E3hr.ra
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: only requested for DECK HIST, 1980-present

Name: Amon.cfc113global
Title (from Variables (Import)): Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113
Field 11: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC113 is CCl2FCClF2.  The IUPAC name for CFC113 is 1,1,2-trichloro-1,2,2-trifluoro-ethane.

Name: Emon.hcont300
Field 12: na

Name: E1hr.pr
Field 12: Total precipitation flux

Name: CFsubhr.pfull
Field 12: Air pressure on model levels [This field is needed only for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Eday.ares
Field 12: aerodynamic_resistance

Name: day.wap
Field 12: commonly referred to as 'omega', this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (8 pressure levels) [XY-P8] [tmean]

Name: 6hrPlev.rv850
Field 12: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

Name: Oyr.ocontemptend
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.hfbasinpmadv
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 11: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 12: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: Odec.hfbasin
Field 12: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: SImon.siflfwbot
Field 12: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)

Name: Emon.conccn
Field 12: 'Number concentration' means the number of particles or other specified objects per unit volume. 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. 'Ambient_aerosol' means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. 'Ambient aerosol particles' are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CF3hr.cls
Field 12: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: SImon.sistrxdtop
Title (from Variables (Import)): X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
Field 11: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
Field 12: X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice
Field 13: Time  mean, weighted by sea ice area, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {on model mest points} [amnsi-twm]

Name: Oyr.pcalc
Field 12: Production rate of Calcite, a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: EdayZ.utendwtem

Field 11: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Upward Advection
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: E3hr.rlut
Field 12: TOA outgoing longwave radiation

Name: EmonZ.utendnogw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 11: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 12: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: CFmon.clws

Field 12: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: LImon.tpf

Name: SImon.sndmasssi

Field 12: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area

Name: AERmon.emibc

Field 11: Total Emission Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
Field 12: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: Omon.physi

Name: Emon.lwtoacsaer
Title (from Variables (Import)): TOA Clear-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Aerosols
Field 11: TOA Clear-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Aerosols
Field 12: Clear-Sky LW-RF Aerosols at TOA

Name: CFmon.rsucs4co2

Name: Omon.hfibthermds
Title (from Variables (Import)): Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

Field 12: [In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.]
