Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {landUse:}

Name: Eday.tsn
Field 12: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as 'missing in regions free of snow on land.

Name: Eday.zg
Field 12: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: ImonGre.hfls
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: E3hrPt.aeroptbnd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Aerosol Level Absorption Optical Thickness for Each Band
Field 11: Aerosol Level Absorption Optical Thickness for Each Band
Field 12: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols in wavelength bands.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] {spectband:} [tpt]

Name: Oyr.ppdiat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Field 11: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Field 12: Primary (organic carbon) production by diatom phytoplankton components alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.dfe
Field 12: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron) [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Amon.tas
Field 12: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature [normally, the temperature should be reported at the 2 meter height]

Name: Omon.ponos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations

Name: Emon.ps
Field 12: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

Name: ImonGre.sbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 12: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: AERmonZ.ta
Field 12: Air Temperature
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Emon.thetaot300
Title (from Variables (Import)): Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 300m
Field 11: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 300m
Field 12: Upper 300m, 2D field

Name: Oyr.fgco2nat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Natural CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Natural CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Gas exchange flux of natural CO2 (positive into ocean)

Name: Omon.msftyzmpa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 11: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 12: CMIP5 called this 'due to Bolus Advection'.  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations. [Function of Y, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftmzmpa) and should in this case be omitted. ]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section [YB-O] [bgzmean]

Name: Emon.rac14
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

Name: CFday.rsut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere

Name: CFmon.tnhusmp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
Field 12: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmon.wetso2
Field 12: Deposition rate of sulfur dioxide due to wet processes

Name: Amon.tasmin
Field 12: monthly mean of the daily-minimum near-surface air temperature. [normally, this should be reported at the 2 meter height.]

Name: Oyr.phnat
Field 12: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (natural component).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Esubhr.tas
Field 12: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:height2m} [tpt]

Name: SImon.sistremax
Title (from Variables (Import)): Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice
Field 11: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice
Field 12: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amnsi-tpt]

Name: Eday.ta
Field 12: The difference is to request greater vertical
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Emon.tSoilPools
Title (from Variables (Import)): Turnover Rate of Each Model Soil Carbon Pool
Field 11: Turnover Rate of Each Model Soil Carbon Pool
Field 12: defined as 1/(turnover time) for each soil pool. Use the same pools reported under cSoilPools

Name: AERday.sfo3max
Title (from Variables (Import)): Daily Maximum O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 11: Daily Maximum O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 12: maximum near-surface ozone  (add cell_methods attribute 'time: maximum')

Name: AERmon.ua
Field 12: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CFsubhr.rldcs
Field 12: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA) [Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: Odec.soga
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Name: E1hrClimMon.rsut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere
Field 13: Mean Diurnal Cycle, Global field (single level) [XY-na]

Name: Omon.limfediaz
Field 12: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: AERmon.ps
Field 12: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

Name: CFday.ta700
Field 12: Air temperature at 700hPa [at 700 hPa level]

Name: SImon.sivol
Field 12: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

Name: LImon.mrroIs
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: CF3hr.cltc
Field 12: For the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes only convective cloud. [Besides the quantities from the Amon table, this is the only other 2-D field in this table.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.co3abio
Field 12: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the abiotic-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Amon.epfy
Field 12: na

Name: CFsubhr.rlds
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Omon.epc100
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Field 11: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Field 12: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [at 100 m depth.]

Name: Oyr.fg14co2abio
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)

Name: AERmon.dms
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmon.n2o
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: ImonGre.rsus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Omon.wfcorr
Field 12: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. [If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Most models now have zero water flux adjustment, in which case ignore or report zero. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.]

Name: CFsubhr.hurs
Field 12: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (specific locations requested by CFMIP) [S-na] {:height2m} [apt-tpt]

Name: Esubhr.hfss
Field 12: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.tnhuspbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 12: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CFmon.rsu
Field 12: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.lwsffluxaero
Title (from Variables (Import)): Longwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols at the Surface
Field 11: Longwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols at the Surface
Field 12: downwelling longwave  flux  due to volcanic aerosols at the surface to be diagnosed through double radiation call
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: day.hursmax
Field 12: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C. [normally report this at 2 meters above the surface]

Name: Omon.limirrmisc
Field 12: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: AERmonZ.o3
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.od550no3
Field 12: Total aerosol AOD due to nitrate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: Emon.clcalipsoliq
Field 12: CALIPSO Liquid Cloud Fraction
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on 40 altitude levels [XY-H40] [tmean]

Name: Emon.rhGrass
Title (from Variables (Import)): Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Total RH of grass in the grid cell

Name: Emon.fNdep
Title (from Variables (Import)): Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land
Field 11: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land
Field 12: Surface deposition rate of nitrogen.

Name: Omon.sob
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor
Field 11: Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor
Field 12: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longititude grid.]

Name: LImon.icemIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Ice Melt Flux
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Ice Melt Flux
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Emon.fNVegSoil
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Field 11: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Field 12: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

Name: Emon.utendnogw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 11: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 12: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Esubhr.rsut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: E3hr.prsnc
Field 12: Convective Snowfall rate

Name: SImon.siareas
Field 12: total area of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

Name: CFmon.dmc
Field 12: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud). [Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: Omon.talknat
Field 12: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2 [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: EdayZ.epfz
Title (from Variables (Import)): Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Field 11: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: LImon.acabfIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Mass Balance Flux
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Mass Balance Flux
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Omon.fbddtdin
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4) [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: CFsubhr.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Odec.masso
Field 12: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

Name: Omon.fric
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
Field 11: Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
Field 12: Inorganic Carbon loss to sediments

Name: SImon.siextents
Field 12: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

Name: AERmon.od550bb
Title (from Variables (Import)): Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Biomass Burning
Field 11: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Biomass Burning
Field 12: total organic aerosol AOD due to biomass burning (excluding so4, nitrate BB components)

Name: CF3hr.rsus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: CFmon.rlu4co2
Field 12: Upwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.rsd
Field 12: Downwelling shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere) [Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: CFsubhr.rlutcs
Field 12: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Emon.fHarvestToProduct
Title (from Variables (Import)): Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool
Field 11: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool
Field 12: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here

Name: LImon.tsIs
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: SImon.siforcecorioly
Title (from Variables (Import)): Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
Field 11: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
Field 12: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force
Field 13: Time  mean, weighted by sea ice area, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {on model mest points} [amnsi-twm]

Name: CFsubhr.rsu
Field 12: Upwelling shortwave radiation  (includes also the fluxes at the surface and top of atmosphere) [Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: AERmon.emidust
Field 12: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: Emon.intuaw
Field 12: Vertically integrated Eastward moisture transport (Mass weighted vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

Name: CF3hr.rsdt
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.ts
Field 12: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.flandice
Title (from Variables (Import)): Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice
Field 11: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice
Field 12: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell

Name: Emon.fVegLitterMortality
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
Field 11: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
Field 12: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Name: E6hrZ.zmlwaero
Title (from Variables (Import)): Zonal Mean Longwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Field 11: Zonal Mean Longwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Field 12: longwave heating rate due to volcanic aerosols to be diagnosed through double radiation call, zonal average values required
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Zonal mean (on model levels) [Y-A] [tpt]

Name: Omon.fgdms
Field 12: Gas exchange flux of DMS (positive into atmosphere)

Name: Emon.vegHeightCrop
Field 12: Vegetation height averaged over the crop fraction of a grid cell.

Name: AERmon.od550so4
Field 12: Total aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: Emon.thetaot
Title (from Variables (Import)): Vertically Averaged Sea Water Potential Temperature
Field 11: Vertically Averaged Sea Water Potential Temperature
Field 12: Vertically averaged ocean temperature

Name: Amon.tauu
Field 12: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

Name: Esubhr.tnhuspbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 12: alevel site time1
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Omon.co3satcalcos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Field 12: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Name: LImon.prsnIs
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: 6hrPlevPt.snw
Field 12: The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amnla-tpt]

Name: AERmon.wetnoy
Title (from Variables (Import)): Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate
Field 11: Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate
Field 12: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.

Name: Omon.intpp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton
Field 11: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton
Field 12: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: Omon.co3satcalc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.cdnc
Field 12: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmonZ.hcl
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Emon.depdust
Field 12: Fdry mass deposition rate of dust

Name: Emon.ua
Field 12: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).
Field 13: Temporal Mean, Global field (7 pressure tropospheric levels) [XY-P7T] [am-tm]

Name: Omon.mfo
Field 12: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m. [Full depth mean, apart from Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is only top 350m.]

Name: ImonGre.snicem
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
Field 12: Loss of snow and ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: AERmon.drybc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
Field 11: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

Name: Omon.pop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of particulate organic phosphorus component concentrations [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: IyrGre.yvelsurf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Field 11: Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Field 12: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'y' indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. 'Land ice' means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.'
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: CFsubhr.tntscpbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 12: To be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Oyr.opottemprmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.nStem
Field 12: including sapwood and hardwood.

Name: LImon.sftgif
Field 12: Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)

Name: 3hr.vas
Field 12: This is sampled synoptically.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:height10m} [tpt]

Name: Emon.opottemppsmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.chl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of 'Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' plus 'Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer" concentrations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.fNloss
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
Field 11: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
Field 12: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching

Name: CFsubhr.phalf
Field 12: Air pressure on model half-levels [This field is needed only for models in which the pressure cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored already for each variable.  Thus, the pressures are needed for height or theta-coordinate models, for example, but not sigma- or eta-coordinate models.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: AERmon.rlutcsaf
Title (from Variables (Import)): TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Longwave Radiation
Field 11: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Longwave Radiation
Field 12: Flux corresponding to rlutcs resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

Name: 6hrPlev.psl
Field 12: Sea Level Pressure

Name: SImon.sitimefrac
Title (from Variables (Import)): Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
Field 11: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
Field 12: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

Name: Omon.zfullo
Title (from Variables (Import)): Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer
Field 11: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer
Field 12: Depth below geoid [This 3-d time dependent field should only be saved for models where it cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored in the file.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.rsdo
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
Field 11: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
Field 12: Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'.  When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'.  In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'.  In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. [In general the shortwave flux should be reported as a function of ocean depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Lmon.cLitter
Field 12: 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

Name: LImon.snc
Field 12: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

Name: EdayZ.utendepfd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to Eliassen-Palm Flux Divergence
Field 11: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to Eliassen-Palm Flux Divergence
Field 12: Called 'acceldivf' in CCMI table; we suggest new name. zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Amon.zg
Field 12: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Esubhr.prc
Field 12: Convective precipitation flux
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: IyrGre.licalvf
Field 12: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Omon.msftmz
Field 12: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized. [Function of latitude, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyz), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section [YB-O] [bzzsum]

Name: LImon.rldsIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Amon.epfz
Field 12: na

Name: Lmon.fLitterSoil
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Field 11: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Field 12: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Name: Omon.htovovrt
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning
Field 11: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning
Field 12: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: Esubhr.tnt
Field 12: Tendency of Air Temperature
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: SIday.sithick
Field 12: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

Name: Eday.mrsll
Title (from Variables (Import)): Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
Field 11: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
Field 12: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on soil levels [XY-S] [amnla-tmn]

Name: Oday.so
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.treeFracBdlDcd
Field 12: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf deciduous trees.

Name: Omon.hfsso
Field 12: Downward sensible heat flux over sea ice free sea. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air. [Report on native horizontal grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (ice free sea) [XY-na] [amnifs-tmn]

Name: Omon.pso
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface
Field 11: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  'Sea water pressure' is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present. [CMIP5 had units of dbar.  CMIP6 uses Pa. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: CFmon.rsd
Field 12: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: Emon.cropFracC3
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

Name: AERmonZ.ho2
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydroperoxyl radical is HO2.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: CFday.mc
Field 12: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud). [Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: Omon.vsfevap
Title (from Variables (Import)): Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
Field 11: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
Field 12: zero for models using real water fluxes. [Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: Emon.netAtmosLandC14Flux
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Name: AERmon.emioa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Primary Emission and Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Field 11: Primary Emission and Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Field 12: This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (emipoa+chepsoa). ''Mass'' refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.  Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: CFsubhr.hfls
Field 12: includes both evaporation and sublimation [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: CFmon.tnhus
Field 12: Tendency of Specific Humidity
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Omon.limirrpico
Field 12: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: Omon.icfriver
Title (from Variables (Import)): Flux of Inorganic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
Field 11: Flux of Inorganic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
Field 12: Inorganic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

Name: Omon.fbddtdic
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: CFsubhr.cl
Field 12: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Eday.jpdftaureliqmodis
Title (from Variables (Import)): MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Field 11: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Field 12: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, liquid

Name: E3hr.vas
Field 12: Near surface northward wind component

Name: Emon.vtendnogw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 11: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Field 12: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: 3hr.rldscs
Field 12: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

Name: AERmon.ptp
Field 12: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

Name: IyrGre.xvelmean
Title (from Variables (Import)): X-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity
Field 11: X-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity
Field 12: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: E1hrClimMon.rlut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)
Field 13: Mean Diurnal Cycle, Global field (single level) [XY-na]

Name: Emon.nLitter
Field 12: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: Oyr.remoc
Field 12: Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.o2sat
Field 12: 'Mole concentration at saturation' means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.cfc11
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of CFC11 in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of CFC11 in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E3hr.clivi
Field 12: Ice water path

Name: Amon.uas
Field 12: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind [normally, the the wind component should be reported at the 10 meter height]

Name: CFmon.hur
Field 12: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: LImon.hfdsn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
Field 11: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
Field 12: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.

Name: AERmon.h2o
Field 12: includes all phases of water
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Omon.sltovgyre
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Gyre
Field 11: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Gyre
Field 12: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: CFsubhr.rsdscs
Field 12: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: CFsubhr.pr
Field 12: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective) [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Emon.cldnci
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Field 11: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Field 12: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Name: LImon.lwsnl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
Field 11: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
Field 12: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

Name: 3hr.mrro
Field 12: the total runoff (including 'drainage' through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell, averaged over the 3-hour interval.

Name: Amon.cl
Field 12: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. [Report on model layers (not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Esubhr.tnhus
Field 12: Tendency of Specific Humidity
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.vsfsit
Title (from Variables (Import)): Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
Field 11: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
Field 12: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux. [The priority set by the WGOMD was 2 for this field.  The sea-ice folks requested that the priority be raised to 1. Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: Emon.tntd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion
Field 12: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Oyr.chlpico
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.eow
Field 12: liquid_water_evaporation_flux_from_open_water

Name: CF3hr.rlutcs
Field 12: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: AERday.zg500
Field 12: geopotential height on the 500 hPa surface

Name: CF3hr.rlut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: AERhr.sfo3
Title (from Variables (Import)): O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 11: O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: Emon.clmisr
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)
Field 11: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)
Field 12: MISR cloud area fraction

Name: Eday.rivi
Field 12: water_flux_to_downstream

Name: Eday.tsl
Field 12: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on soil levels [XY-S] [amnla-tmn]

Name: EmonZ.oxprod
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Omon.intppdiaz
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Field 11: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Field 12: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophs alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: CF3hr.prc
Field 12: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.talkos
Field 12: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)

Name: Odec.thetao
Field 12: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field. [Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.ppdiaz
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Field 11: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Field 12: Primary (organic carbon) production by diazotroph components alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.agesno
Field 12: age_of_surface_snow

Name: Omon.chlpico
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: 6hrLev.ec550aer
Field 12: Aerosol Extinction @550nm
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] {:lambda550nm} [amn-tpt]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.hurs
Field 12: na

Name: CF3hr.rsutcs
Field 12: Calculated in the absence of clouds.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Eday.loadoa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Field 11: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Field 12: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere_primary_organic_content and atmosphere_secondary_organic_content (see next two table entries).

Name: Emon.prthetao
Field 12: A passive tracer in an ocean model which is subject to an externally imposed perturbative surface heat flux. The passive tracer is initialised to the potential temperature in the control climate before the perturbation is imposed. Its surface flux is the heat flux from the atmosphere, not including the imposed perturbation, and is converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were being added to potential temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were potential temperature.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.difmxylo
Field 12: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.co
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: day.rlds
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

Name: Oyr.dfe
Field 12: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Amon.rsuscs
Field 12: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky Shortwave Radiation

Name: Lmon.c3PftFrac
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type
Field 11: Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees). [Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: SImon.sistrxubot
Title (from Variables (Import)): X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Field 11: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Field 12: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

Name: Omon.limfepico
Field 12: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: Emon.cldicemxrat
Field 12: na

Name: day.mrro
Field 12: computed as the total runoff (including 'drainage' through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell.

Name: Emon.pabigthetao
Field 12: A passive tracer in an ocean model whose surface flux does not come from the atmosphere but is imposed externally upon the simulated climate system. The surface flux is expressed as a heat flux and converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were a heat flux being added to conservative temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were conservative temperature. The passive tracer is zero in the control climate of the model.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.fbddtalk
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.cLitterSubSurf
Field 12: subsurface litter pool fed by root inputs.

Name: Omon.epfe100
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [at 100 m depth.]

Name: CFsubhr.prsn
Field 12: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: CFmon.clc

Name: Emon.sweLut

Field 11: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'lwe' means liquid water equivalent. 'Amount' means mass per unit area. The construction lwe_thickness_of_X_amount or _content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.

Name: Omon.masscello
Field 12: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [asm-tmean]

Name: Emon.opottemptend

Name: Emon.nppOther
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

Name: Oyr.cfc12
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of CFC12 in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of CFC12 in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.fbddtdife
Field 12: na

Name: Eday.ts
Field 12: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations

Name: 6hrPlev.ua
Field 12: na

Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Soil on Grass Tiles
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Soil on Grass Tiles

Name: Omon.dmsos

Name: CFsubhr.tntmp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Field 12: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: IyrGre.yvelbase

Field 11: Y-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Field 12: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'y' indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. 'Land ice' means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. 'basal' means the lower boundary of the land ice.

[In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.]

Name: day.rlus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. Field 11: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation
Field 12: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.

Name: AERmonZ.oh

Name: Omon.co3abioos
