Name: E3hr.psl
Field 12: Sea level pressure

Name: CF3hr.prcprof
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. [report on model half-levels]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.expsi
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.talknat
Field 12: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E3hrPt.clmisr
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)
Field 11: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)
Field 12: MISR optical thickness - height histogram
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (16 altitudes) [XY-H16] {tau:} [amn-tpt]

Name: AERmon.c3h8
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CF3hr.zfull
Field 12: This is actual height above mean sea level, not geopotential height
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.chldiat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.bddtdip
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Dissolved Phosphorus Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Dissolved Phosphorus Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved phosphorus
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.hfrainds
Title (from Variables (Import)): Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Field 11: Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Field 12: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale. [Report on native horizontal grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (ice free sea) [XY-na] [amnifs-tmn]

Name: Emon.c14Land
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Field 11: Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Field 12: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

Name: Omon.chlcalcos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

Name: E1hrClimMon.rsdt
Field 12: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere
Field 13: Mean Diurnal Cycle, Global field (single level) [XY-na]

Name: Lmon.rh
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)

Name: Oyr.si
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Dissolved inorganic silicon' means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.tas
Field 12: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (specific locations requested by CFMIP) [S-na] {:height2m} [apt-tpt]

Name: AERmon.chepsoa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Field 11: Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Field 12: If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as OA emissions. ''mass'' refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

Name: Oclim.tnkebto
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements. [3-d time dependent field]
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: Emon.mrlso
Field 12: The mass (summed over all all layers) of liquid water.

Name: AERmon.od870aer
Field 12: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute 'wavelength: 870 nm'

Name: Esubhr.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.tslsiLut
Field 12: Surface temperature (i.e. temperature at which long-wave radiation emitted)

Name: Omon.sfdsi
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Field 11: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Field 12: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.]

Name: Emon.twap
Title (from Variables (Import)): Product of Air Temperature and Omega
Field 11: Product of Air Temperature and Omega
Field 12: Product of air temperature and pressure tendency
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmon.zg
Field 12: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Lmon.cCwd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Field 12: Carbon mass per unit area in woody debris (dead organic matter composed of coarse wood.  It is distinct from litter)

Name: EmonZ.tntrs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: CFmon.rldcs
Field 12: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: Eday.clivic
Field 12: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: Emon.expsi
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFday.rldscs
Field 12: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation

Name: E3hr.prrc
Field 12: Convective Rainfall rate

Name: Oyr.bddtalk
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.hfcorr
Field 12: Flux correction is also called 'flux adjustment'. A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. [If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Positive indicates correction adds heat to ocean. Report on native horizontal grid as well as remapped onto a latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: Emon.fracLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Field 11: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Field 12: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5*0.2 = 0.1)

Name: Emon.vegFrac
Field 12: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

Name: E3hrPt.solbnd
Title (from Variables (Import)): TOA Solar Irradiance for Each Band
Field 11: TOA Solar Irradiance for Each Band
Field 12: Solar irradiance at a horizontal surface at top of atmosphere.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {spectband:} [tpt]

Name: 6hrPlev.va
Field 12: na

Name: IfxGre.topg
Field 12: The bedrock topography beneath the land ice
Field 13: Time invariant, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid, Grounded [XYG-na] [amgi-fx]

Name: E3hrPt.va
Field 12: na

Name: CFsubhr.mc
Field 12: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts). [Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: Amon.rsdscs
Field 12: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

Name: Oyr.fgco2abio
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Abiotic CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as Abiotic CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Gas exchange flux of abiotic CO2 (positive into ocean)

Name: Oyr.bddtdic
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Field 11: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Field 12: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Amon.mc
Field 12: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell. [Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.rlut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements) [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: AERmon.cltc
Field 12: Convective cloud fraction

Name: fx.orog
Field 12: height above the geoid; as defined here, 'the geoid' is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level) [XY-na]

Name: CFsubhr.cct
Title (from Variables (Import)): Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Field 11: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Field 12: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: CF3hr.clt
Field 12: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.frfe
Field 12: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.

Name: Eday.et
Field 12: na

Name: AERmon.ztp
Field 12: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

Name: Odec.sos
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.  [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: Omon.cfc12
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of CFC12 in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of CFC12 in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.fco2antt
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: CFmon.rsd4co2
Field 12: Downwelling shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: Efx.rlu
Field 12: Fluxes are requested at all levels

Name: 6hrPlev.vas
Field 12: Near surface northward wind

Name: CFsubhr.rsus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Emon.hfssLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Field 11: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Field 12: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Name: Oyr.dissicnat
Field 12: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.phnatos

Name: ImonAnt.rlus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: SImon.sitemptop
Field 12: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

Name: CF3hr.ci
Title (from Variables (Import)): Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell

Name: SImon.sirdgthick
Field 12: Sea Ice Ridge Height (representing mean height over the ridged area)

Name: CFmon.clic
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Field 12: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: SImon.sisaltmass

Name: Amon.o3
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. [If this does not change over time (except possibly to vary identically over each annual cycle), report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. If CO2 is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of CO2 (see the table entry before the previous one).]

Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.limfemisc
Field 12: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Miscellaneous phytoplankton' are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: Omon.sos
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.  [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: Emon.wtd
Field 12: Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. The water table is the surface below which the soil is saturated with water such that all pore spaces are filled.

Name: Emon.swsrfasdust
Title (from Variables (Import)): All-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Field 11: All-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Field 12: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover.

Name: Emon.uqint
Field 12: Eastward integrated moisture transport

Name: Omon.phypico
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: SImon.siconca
Field 12: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice
Field 13: Temporal weighted mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:typesi} [amse-tmn]

Name: Emon.netAtmosLandC13Flux
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).-

Name: Omon.dpco2
Field 12: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  [Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of CO2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)]

Name: IyrGre.libmassbffl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
Field 11: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
Field 12: quantity averaged over floating land ice
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amnfi-twmn]

Name: Emon.mrsol
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Field 11: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Field 12: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on soil levels [XY-S] [amnla-tmn]

Name: Omon.chlmiscos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone

Name: Oyr.opottempmint
Title (from Variables (Import)): Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Field 11: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Field 12: Full column sum of density*cell thickness*potential temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor. [Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: Eday.hfdsn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
Field 11: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
Field 12: Downward heat flux at snow top

Name: Omon.limnpico
Field 12: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: Emon.rhLitter
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
Field 12: Needed to calculate litter bulk turnover time. Includes respiration from CWD as well.

Name: Omon.uo
Field 12: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.spco2
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Field 11: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

Name: SImon.sisnconc
Field 12: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.

Name: Oday.zos
Field 12: na

Name: Omon.phydiaz
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E3hrPt.cltcalipso
Field 12: CALIPSO Total Cloud Fraction
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.fddtdife
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Iron
Field 11: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Iron
Field 12: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: E3hr.prcsh
Field 12: Shallow convection precipitation flux

Name: SImon.sidmassmeltbot
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting
Field 11: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting
Field 12: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area

Name: Emon.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Field 13: Temporal Mean, Global field (7 pressure tropospheric levels) [XY-P7T] [am-tm]

Name: ImonAnt.icem
Field 12: Loss of ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt water on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Emon.jpdftaureicemodis
Title (from Variables (Import)): MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Field 11: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Field 12: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, ice

Name: AERmon.wetoa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
Field 11: Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
Field 12: Deposition rate of organic matter in aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

Name: E1hr.psl
Field 12: Sea level pressure
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: AERhr.sfno2
Title (from Variables (Import)): NO2 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 11: NO2 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: Lmon.cSoilSlow
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool
Field 12: fast is meant as lifetime of more than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)

Name: 6hrPlevPt.tas
Field 12: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:height2m} [tpt]

Name: CFsubhr.edt
Field 12: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: CFsubhr.zg
Field 12: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Emon.c14Soil
Field 12: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

Name: Esubhr.ta
Field 12: Air Temperature
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: CFday.zg
Field 12: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.fNAnthDisturb
Title (from Variables (Import)): Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity
Field 11: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity
Field 12: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...

Name: Emon.thetaot2000
Title (from Variables (Import)): Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 2000m
Field 11: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 2000m
Field 12: Upper 2000m, 2D field

Name: Emon.wap2
Field 12: omega*omega
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: EmonZ.tntrscs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Emon.cldncl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Field 11: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Field 12: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Name: ImonGre.icem
Field 12: Loss of ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt water on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Omon.zmeso
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E3hrPt.ta
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.wetlandCH4
Title (from Variables (Import)): Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands
Field 11: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands
Field 12: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Name: Eyr.fracInLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles
Field 11: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles
Field 12: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Name: Emon.necbLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere

Name: CF3hr.clis
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Field 12: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.irrLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns
Field 11: Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns
Field 12: Mass flux of water due to irrigation.

Name: CFsubhr.ps
Field 12: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Amon.rlus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

Name: EmonZ.epfy
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Field 11: Northward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Field 12: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Meridional component Fy of Eliassen-Palm (EP) flux (Fy, Fz) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available). Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3a of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book, but scaled by density to have units m3 s-2.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Emon.vegHeightTree
Field 12: Vegetation height averaged over the tree fraction of a grid cell.

Name: SIday.siconc
Field 12: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice
Field 13: Temporal weighted mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:typesi} [amse-tmn]

Name: Omon.detocos
Field 12: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

Name: Eday.zmla
Field 12: Height of Boundary Layer

Name: Omon.sios
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
Field 11: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Dissolved inorganic silicon' means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

Name: CFsubhr.ta
Field 12: Air Temperature
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Oyr.co3nat
Field 12: Surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the natural-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.wap
Field 12: commonly referred to as 'omega', this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: CF3hr.reffclwc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Field 11: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Field 12: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Eday.prra
Field 12: rainfall_flux

Name: Omon.dissicnatos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Natural Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Field 11: Surface Natural Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Field 12: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

Name: SImon.sifllwdtop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Field 11: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Field 12: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)

Name: Emon.raLeaf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: added for completeness with Ra_root

Name: Amon.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Amon.tauv
Field 12: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

Name: Emon.cldnvi
Field 12: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

Name: SImon.siflswdtop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Field 11: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Field 12: The downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always positive by sign convention)

Name: Esubhr.tntrl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating
Field 12: alevel site time1
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Oyr.difmxybo

Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.dryss
Title (from Variables (Import)): Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Field 11: Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol

Name: Oyr.expfe
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.sci

Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Emon.reffclwc

Field 11: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

Name: Oyr.phyc

Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: ImonGre.orog

Name: Oyr.detoc

Name: EmonZ.tntrl

Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT

Name: Emon.rlusLut

Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

Name: Oyr.zooc

Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFmon.mcu
Field 12: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud). [Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: ImonGre.hfss
Field 12: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.ta
Field 12: Air Temperature [on the following pressure levels: 850, 500, 250 hPa]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (3 pressure levels) [XY-P3] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.wetlandFrac
Field 12: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

Name: Oyr.calc
Field 12: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.intpbfe
Field 12: Vertically integrated biogenic iron production
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: CFsubhr.sfcWind
Field 12: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (specific locations requested by CFMIP) [S-na] {:height10m} [apt-tpt]

Name: Emon.expp
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Odec.wo
Field 12: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.pnitrate
Field 12: na

Name: Eday.cw
Field 12: canopy_water_amount

Name: CFday.cllcalipso
Title (from Variables (Import)): CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Field 11: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Field 12: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa

Name: LImon.rsdsIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: LImon.snm
Field 12: Computed as the total surface melt water on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

Name: Emon.opottempmint
Title (from Variables (Import)): Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Field 11: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Field 12: Integral over the full ocean depth of the product of sea water density and potential temperature.

Name: EmonZ.oxloss
Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Omon.phyfe
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFday.hus
Field 12: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Oyr.diftrblo
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 11: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Field 12: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the 'thickness' diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called 'ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity'.  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.ocontempmint
Title (from Variables (Import)): Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature
Field 11: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature
Field 12: Full column sum of density*cell thickness*conservative temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.

Name: Oyr.graz
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton
Field 11: Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton
Field 12: Total grazing of phytoplankton by zooplankton defined as tendency of moles of carbon per cubic metre.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.mrrob
Field 12: subsurface_runoff_flux

Name: Emon.nMineral
Field 12: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

Name: Omon.limirrdiaz
Field 12: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: Omon.limndiat
Field 12: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: Eday.tdps
Field 12: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

Name: Emon.fLulccResidueLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Transferred to Soil or Litter Pools Due to Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Processes on Tile
Field 11: Carbon Transferred to Soil or Litter Pools Due to Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Processes on Tile
Field 12: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon into soil or litter pools due to any land use or land-cover change activities

Name: Omon.phyc
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations.  In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., 'Diatom Carbon Concentration' and 'Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration' [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFmon.tnta
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
Field 12: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Odec.sfdsi
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Field 11: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Field 12: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.]

Name: Omon.epn100
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [at 100 m depth.]

Name: Emon.grassFracC4
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.

Name: AERmon.eminh3
Field 12: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: Emon.fLulccProductLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Harvested Due to Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Process That Enters Anthropogenic Product Pools on Tile
Field 11: Carbon Harvested Due to Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Process That Enters Anthropogenic Product Pools on Tile
Field 12: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon primarily through harvesting land use into anthropogenic product pools, e.g.,deforestation or wood harvesting from primary or secondary lands, food harvesting on croplands, harvesting (grazing) by animals on pastures.

Name: 3hr.rsdscs
Field 12: This is a 3-hour mean flux.

Name: Eday.snd
Field 12: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

Name: Omon.limfecalc
Field 12: 'Calcareous phytoplankton' are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: Omon.vsf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water
Field 11: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water
Field 12: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux. [If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Positive flux implies correction increases salinity of water.  This includes all virtual salt flux, including that due to a salt flux correction.  Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: Emon.pastureFracC3
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture

Name: Eday.clwvic
Field 12: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: Emon.tasLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Near-Surface Air Temperature on Land Use Tile
Field 11: Near-Surface Air Temperature on Land Use Tile
Field 12: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

Name: Amon.siconca
Field 12: na

Name: AERmon.chepasoa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Net Production of Anthropogenic Secondary Organic Aerosol
Field 11: Total Net Production of Anthropogenic Secondary Organic Aerosol
Field 12: anthropogenic part of chepsoa

Name: SImon.siage
Field 12: Age of sea ice

Name: SIday.siv
Field 12: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid
Field 13: Time  mean, weighted by sea ice area, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {on model mest points} [amnsi-twm]

Name: Omon.sltovovrt
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Overturning
Field 11: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Overturning
Field 12: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: Eday.mrfsofr
Title (from Variables (Import)): Average Layer Fraction of Frozen Moisture
Field 11: Average Layer Fraction of Frozen Moisture
Field 12: mass_fraction_of_frozen_water_in_soil_layer
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on soil levels [XY-S] [amnla-tmn]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.swtoafluxaerocs
Title (from Variables (Import)): TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Field 11: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Field 12: downwelling shortwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: LImon.rsusIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: SImon.siitdthick
Field 12: K=ice depth bands

Name: Omon.intppcalc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
Field 11: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
Field 12: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the calcareous phytoplankton component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.rsdt
Field 12: na

Name: Omon.dmso
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: 3hr.hfss
Field 12: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

Name: SImon.sidmassmelttop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting
Field 11: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting
Field 12: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area

Name: Lmon.residualFrac
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
Field 11: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
Field 12: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by 'non-vegetation' and 'non-bare-soil' (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.) [add scalar coordinate type???and add "???" to the CF area type table.]

Name: SImon.sirdgconc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Ridging
Field 11: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Ridging
Field 12: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .
Field 13: Temporal weighted mean, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:typesirdg} [amnsi-twm]

Name: Emon.t2
Field 12: Air temperature squared
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CFmon.cltcalipso
Field 12: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: IyrGre.acabf
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: CFmon.tnhusc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection
Field 12: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmonZ.hno3
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.rv850
Field 12: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:p850}

Name: 6hrPlev.tas
Field 12: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature

Name: CFmon.albisccp
Field 12: time-means weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

Name: CFsubhr.ccb
Title (from Variables (Import)): Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Field 11: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Field 12: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Omon.eparag100
Field 12: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Aragonite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of aragonite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for calcite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate. [at 100 m depth.]

Name: Emon.tnhusscp
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Field 12: The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Specific' means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmon.abs550aer
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550nm
Field 11: Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550nm
Field 12: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols at wavelength 550 nanometers.

Name: Eday.reffsclwtop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Field 11: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Field 12: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius 'as seen from space' over liquid stratiform cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Name: Amon.fco2nat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., 'net ecosystem biospheric productivity', for land, and 'air to sea CO2 flux', for ocean.) [Report from all simulations (both emission-driven and concentration-driven) performed by models with fully interactive and responsive carbon cycles.]

Name: 6hrLev.bs550aer
Field 12: Aerosol  Backscatter at wavelength 550nm and scattering angle 180 degrees, computed from extinction and lidar ratio
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] {:lambda550nm} [amn-tpt]

Name: Eday.dmlt
Field 12: depth_of_subsurface_melting
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (at zero Centigrade soil isotherm) [XY-na] {:stempzero} [amunf-twm]

Name: Emon.nSoil
Field 12: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: Lmon.grassFrac
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass. [add scalar coordinate typegrass and add "natural_grass" to the CF area type table.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: Omon.so
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.  [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.o2satos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
Field 11: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
Field 12: 'Mole concentration at saturation' means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

Name: AERmon.rsutcsaf
Title (from Variables (Import)): TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Field 11: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Field 12: Flux corresponding to rsutcs resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

Name: AERday.zg1000
Field 12: Geopotential height on the 1000 hPa surface

Name: Emon.c14Veg
Field 12: only requested for DECK HIST

Name: Emon.tntmp
Field 12: na

Name: SImon.sivols
Field 12: total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

Name: Emon.lwsrfcsdust
Title (from Variables (Import)): Clear-Sky Surface Longwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Field 11: Clear-Sky Surface Longwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Field 12: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculating in clear-sky conditions.

Name: Omon.fddtdic
Title (from Variables (Import)): Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Carbon
Field 11: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Carbon
Field 12: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Dissolved inorganic carbon' describes a family of chemical species in solution, including carbon dioxide, carbonic acid and the carbonate and bicarbonate anions. 'Dissolved inorganic carbon' is the term used in standard names for all species belonging to the family that are represented within a given model. The list of individual species that are included in a quantity having a group chemical standard name can vary between models.  Where possible, the data variable should be accompanied by a complete description of the species represented, for example, by using a comment attribute. [integral over upper 100 m only.]

Name: Lmon.lai
Field 12: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows. [Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: Eday.prw
Field 12: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

Name: Oyr.phabio
Field 12: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (abiotic component)..
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oday.wo
Field 12: na

Name: AERmon.lossco
Title (from Variables (Import)): Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Carbon Monoxide
Field 11: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Carbon Monoxide
Field 12: monthly averaged atmospheric loss
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.cLand
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Field 11: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Field 12: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: Lmon.rMaint
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Maintenance respiration is defined as the carbon cost to support the metabolic activity of existing live tissue. [This flux and rGrowth provide a breakdown of the higher priority "Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration" [ra]; thus the sum should be identical to that.]

Name: AERmon.rlutaf
Field 12: Flux corresponding to rlut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

Name: Amon.rlds
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

Name: day.sfcWindmax
Field 12: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed. [normally, report this at 10 meters above the surface]

Name: Lmon.tran
Field 12: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

Name: Emon.cSoilShrub
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Soil on Shrub Tiles
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Soil on Shrub Tiles
Field 12: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The 'soil content' of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content_of_soil_layer are used.

Name: ImonGre.rsds
Field 12: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: IyrGre.xvelsurf
Title (from Variables (Import)): X-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Field 11: X-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Field 12: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'x' indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. 'Land ice' means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Oyr.osaltrmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 12: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from residual mean  (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced)  advection. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.intppmisc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Field 11: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Field 12: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: IyrAnt.snc
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice sheet  only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Emon.concnmcn
Title (from Variables (Import)): Number Concentration of Nucleation Mode Aerosol
Field 11: Number Concentration of Nucleation Mode Aerosol
Field 12: includes all particles with diameter smaller than 3 nm
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: SImon.siextentn
Field 12: Total area of all Northern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

Name: Amon.huss
Field 12: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity. [Normally, the specific humidity should be reported at the 2 meter height]

Name: Oyr.phydiat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: 6hrLev.ua
Field 12: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction). [on all model levels]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [tpt]

Name: Omon.co3satarag
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
