Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: 6hrLev.pfull
Field 12: Air Pressure (required only if pressure on model levels cannot be derived from other fields, e.g. for a non-hydrostatic model)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.zos
Field 12: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice. [See OMDP document for details. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: Odec.bigthetaoga
Title (from Variables (Import)): Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Field 11: Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Field 12: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Name: Emon.nOther
Title (from Variables (Import)): Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root
Field 11: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root
Field 12: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.

Name: CF3hr.reffclis
Title (from Variables (Import)): Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Field 11: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Field 12: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.nRoot
Field 12: including fine and coarse roots.

Name: Emon.rhc13
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ('consumers'), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ('producers') do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Name: SImon.sidmasslat
Field 12: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)

Name: SImon.sidmassevapsubl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
Field 11: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
Field 12: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area

Name: Oyr.pbfe
Field 12: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.o2sat
Field 12: 'Mole concentration at saturation' means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.ocontemprmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 12: Conservative Temperature is defined as part of the Thermodynamic Equation of Seawater 2010 (TEOS-10) which was adopted in 2010 by the International Oceanographic Commission (IOC). The phrase 'residual mean advection' refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.phypico
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.limfediat
Field 12: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Iron growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: Amon.clw
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Field 11: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Field 12: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model. [Report on model layers (not standard pressures).]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.swsrfcsdust
Title (from Variables (Import)): Clear-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Field 11: Clear-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Field 12: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculated in clear-sky conditions.

Name: Amon.psl
Field 12: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

Name: Emon.rhc14
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ('consumers'), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ('producers') do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Name: Emon.cTotFireLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Carbon Loss from Natural and Managed Fire on Land-Use Tile, Including Deforestation Fires [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Total Carbon Loss from Natural and Managed Fire on Land-Use Tile, Including Deforestation Fires [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Different from LMON this flux should include all fires occurring on the land use tile, including natural, man-made and deforestation fires

Name: Omon.zmicroos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Name: Eday.dfr
Field 12: na

Name: E3hr.rsut
Field 12: TOA outgoing shortwave radiation

Name: Omon.hfds
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Field 11: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Field 12: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') . [Report on native horizontal grid as well as remapped onto a latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: CFmon.rsutcs4co2
Title (from Variables (Import)): TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Field 11: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Field 12: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Name: Emon.intvaw
Field 12: Vertically integrated Northward moisture transport (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

Name: Omon.co3sataragos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Field 12: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Name: AERmon.lossn2o
Title (from Variables (Import)): Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide
Field 11: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide
Field 12: monthly averaged atmospheric loss
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmonZ.meanage
Field 12: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Omon.phabioos
Field 12: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Name: CFsubhr.prw
Field 12: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: CFsubhr.rsdt
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Omon.wfo
Field 12: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum *wfonocorr* and *wfcorr*. [net flux of water into sea water, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.]

Name: Emon.fNfert
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)
Field 11: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)
Field 12: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area

Name: Oclim.difvmo
Field 12: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to momentum.
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.tsl
Field 12: Temperature of single near-surface soil layer.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:sdepth1} [amnla-tpt]

Name: Odec.agessc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact
Field 11: Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact
Field 12: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: SImon.sisnhc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
Field 11: Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
Field 12: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.

Name: IyrGre.zvelsurf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity
Field 11: Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity
Field 12: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Omon.ficeberg
Title (from Variables (Import)): Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Field 11: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Field 12: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. ]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E1hr.rlut
Field 12: outgoing LW radiation at TOA
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: LImon.snicefreezIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Emon.wap
Field 12: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CF3hr.clc
Field 12: Include only convective cloud.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: IyrGre.snc
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice sheet  only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Amon.prc
Field 12: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

Name: CF3hr.sci
Title (from Variables (Import)): Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Field 11: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Field 12: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell. [For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme only.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: CFsubhr.clt
Field 12: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Omon.tos
Field 12: This may differ from 'surface temperature' in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature. [Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.]

Name: Emon.sconcso4
Field 12: mass concentration of sulfate dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer.

Name: AERmon.mmraerh2o
Field 12: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. 'Ambient_aerosol' means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. 'Ambient aerosol particles' are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Oyr.volcello
Field 12: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields [a 3-d field: For oceans with more than 1 mesh, report on grid that applies to temperature]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [asm-tmean]

Name: Oyr.phyfe
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.osaltdiff
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Field 12: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.diftrelo
Field 12: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: LImon.sblIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Eday.loaddust
Field 12: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

Name: Amon.hus
Field 12: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Omon.smoc
Field 12: na

Name: SImon.sifb
Field 12: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

Name: Emon.cSoilAbove1m
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth
Field 11: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth
Field 12: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: 6hrLev.ta
Field 12: Air Temperature [on all model levels]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Eyr.cLitter
Field 12: 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amnla-tpt]

Name: Amon.hur
Field 12: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: AERday.cod
Field 12: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. 'Cloud' means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

Name: Eday.rivo
Field 12: water_flux_from_upstream

Name: Lmon.nppRoot
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP

Name: Omon.evs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Field 11: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Field 12: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. [Report on native horizontal grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (ice free sea) [XY-na] [amnifs-tmn]

Name: Eday.tauupbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Eastward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
Field 11: Eastward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
Field 12: surface

Name: Emon.opottemppadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.rsucs
Field 12: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA) [Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: Omon.fgo2
Field 12: Gas exchange flux of O2 (positive into ocean)

Name: LImon.hfssIs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ice Sheet Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Field 11: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Eday.loadbc
Field 12: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

Name: Emon.rac13
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

Name: CFmon.tnhusscpbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 11: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Field 12: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: IyrGre.zvelbase
Title (from Variables (Import)): Upward Component of Land-Ice Basal Velocity
Field 11: Upward Component of Land-Ice Basal Velocity
Field 12: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). 'basal' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: Emon.ppmisc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Field 11: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Field 12: Primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.fco2nat
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., 'net ecosystem biospheric productivity', for land, and 'air to sea CO2 flux', for ocean.) [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Esubhr.wap
Field 12: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Amon.hursmin
Field 12: na

Name: Oyr.somint
Title (from Variables (Import)): Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity
Field 11: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity
Field 12: Full column sum of density*cell thickness*salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor. [Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: E3hr.clwvi
Field 12: Liquid water path

Name: Lmon.treeFracPrimEver
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage Cover by Primary Evergreen Trees
Field 11: Percentage Cover by Primary Evergreen Trees
Field 12: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees. [Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: CF3hr.evspsbl
Field 12: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Lmon.nppWood
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Production Allocated to Wood as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Primary Production Allocated to Wood as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP

Name: LImon.snw
Field 12: Computed as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excluded is snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

Name: AERmonZ.zg
Field 12: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Omon.zostoga
Title (from Variables (Import)): Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
Field 11: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
Field 12: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.

Name: Emon.ocontemppadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: 6hrPlev.uas
Field 12: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

Name: Oyr.po4
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Dissolved inorganic phosphorus' means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.zhalfo
Title (from Variables (Import)): Depth Below Geoid of Interfaces Between Ocean Layers
Field 11: Depth Below Geoid of Interfaces Between Ocean Layers
Field 12: Depth below geoid [This 3-d time dependent field should only be saved for models where it cannot be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored in the file.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model half levels [XY-OH] [tmean]

Name: AERmon.emilnox
Field 12: Integrate the NOx production for lightning over model layer. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_nox_from_lightning
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Omon.dpo2
Field 12: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. [Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of O2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)]

Name: SImon.sitempbot
Field 12: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer

Name: ImonAnt.tas
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

Name: CFday.wap500
Field 12: at 500 hPa level; commonly referred to as 'omega', this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

Name: Eday.sootsn
Field 12: soot_content_of_surface_snow

Name: Emon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Name: Amon.sbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 12: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere. [This differs from sbl appearing in table Limon in that the flux is averaged over the entire grid cell, not just the land portion.]

Name: Amon.clwvi
Field 12: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: Omon.dissicnat
Field 12: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2 [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.osaltpadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Field 12: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection). [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: IfxGre.lithk
Field 12: The thickness of the ice sheet
Field 13: Time invariant, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid, Ice Sheet [XYG-na] [ami-fx]

Name: CFmon.evu
Field 12: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CF3hr.rsut
Field 12: at the top of the atmosphere
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Lmon.fco2nat
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.orog
Field 12: Monthly mean orography (needed if land ice has time varying altitude)

Name: LImon.orogIs
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: E3hrPt.o3
Field 12: Mole Fraction of O3
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.wo
Field 12: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: LImon.tasIs
Field 12: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Name: Lmon.fVegSoil
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Field 11: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Field 12: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

Name: AERmon.mmrnh4
Field 12: Dry mass fraction of ammonium aerosol particles in air.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Oday.chlos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations at the sea surface.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of 'Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' plus 'Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration'

Name: Emon.cStem
Field 12: including sapwood and hardwood.

Name: Oyr.zmicro
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Eday.loadss
Field 12: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

Name: CFmon.rlucs
Field 12: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [tmean]

Name: day.tslsi
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
Field 11: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
Field 12: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.

Name: AERmon.tntrs
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Field 12: shortwave heating rates
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Omon.no3os
Field 12: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: Amon.fco2fos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.) [This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.zg500
Field 12: geopotential height on the 500 hPa surface
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:p500}

Name: AERmonZ.va
Field 12: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Emon.jpdftaureliqmodis
Title (from Variables (Import)): MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Field 11: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Field 12: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, liquid

Name: Emon.co23D
Field 12: requested for all Emissions-driven runs
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Emon.fbddtdip
Field 12: na

Name: AERmon.tatp
Field 12: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

Name: Eday.sbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 12: surface_snow_and_ice_sublimation_flux

Name: Omon.msftmzsmpa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 11: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 12: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization. [Function of latitude, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyzsmpa), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section [YB-O] [bzzsum]

Name: 3hr.clt
Field 12: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is a 3-hour mean.

Name: Eday.tauu
Field 12: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

Name: Emon.ocontemptend
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Amon.sfcWind
Field 12: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind [normally, the the wind  should be reported at the 10 meter height]

Name: CF3hr.sbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 12: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere. [This differs from sbl appearing in table Limon in that the flux is averaged over the entire grid cell, not just the land portion.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Oyr.zmeso
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CFsubhr.sbl
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 11: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Field 12: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Emon.treeFracNdlDcd
Field 12: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.

Name: Lmon.rGrowth
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Autotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Total Autotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Growth respiration is defined as the additional carbon cost for the synthesis of new growth. [This flux and rMaint provide a breakdown of the higher priority "Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration" [ra]; thus the sum should be identical to that.]

Name: day.uas
Field 12: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind [normally, report this at 10 meters above the surface]

Name: Amon.cct
Title (from Variables (Import)): Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Field 11: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Field 12: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Name: Omon.dissoc
Field 12: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit) [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: SImon.siflcondtop
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Conductive Heat Flux in Ice at the Surface
Field 11: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Ice at the Surface
Field 12: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface

Name: AERmon.emiaco
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic CO
Field 11: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic CO
Field 12: anthrophogenic  emission of CO

Name: ImonAnt.hfss
Field 12: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: SImon.siareaacrossline
Field 12: Flux across 4 straits

Name: IyrGre.litempbotgr
Title (from Variables (Import)): Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
Field 11: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
Field 12: quantity averaged over grounded land ice
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amngi-twmn]

Name: SImon.sndmasswindrif
Title (from Variables (Import)): Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
Field 11: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
Field 12: the rate of change of snow mass through wind drift of snow (from sea-ice into the sea) divided by sea-ice area

Name: Oclim.difvtrto
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Vertical Tracer Diffusivity Due to Tides
Field 11: Ocean Vertical Tracer Diffusivity Due to Tides
Field 12: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to tracers due to tides (i.e. caused by astronomical gravity changes which manifest as tides).
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: 6hrPlevPt.mrsol
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Field 11: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Field 12: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value),, Global field on soil levels [XY-S] [amn-tpt]

Name: E3hrPt.ua
Field 12: na

Name: CF3hr.prsnc
Field 12: convective precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase. [report on model half-levels]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field on model atmosphere half-levels [XY-AH] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.phymisc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: CF3hr.rlus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.fbddtdisi
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.rhShrub
Title (from Variables (Import)): Heterotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Heterotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Total RH of shrubs in the grid cell

Name: Oclim.difvso
Field 12: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field.
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: Eyr.baresoilFrac

Name: Lmon.cProduct

Field 12: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

Name: Oyr.fescav

For completeness, provide this even if the ocean grid is the same as the atmospheric grid.]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-fx]

Name: Omon.hflso

Name: Emon.prbigthetao
Field 12: A passive tracer in an ocean model which is subject to an externally imposed perturbative surface heat flux. The passive tracer is initialised to the conservative temperature in the control climate before the perturbation is imposed. Its surface flux is the heat flux from the atmosphere, not including the imposed perturbation, and is converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were being added to conservative temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were conservative temperature.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Title (from Variables (Import)): Wood and Agricultural Product Pool Carbon Associated with Land-Use Tiles

Examples of products include paper, cardboard, timber for construction, and crop harvest for food or fuel. Does NOT include residue which is deposited into soil or litter; end of year values (not annual mean).
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] {landUse:}

The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Surface litter' means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Name: Esubhr.pr

Name: Omon.mlotstsq
Title (from Variables (Import)): Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Field 11: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Field 12: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by 'temperature', 'sigma', 'sigma_theta', 'sigma_t' or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. 'Thickness' means the vertical extent of a layer. [Report on native horizontal grid.]

Field 12: This is the in-cloud emissivity obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

Name: ImonGre.rlds
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

To facilitate model comparison, it is also requested that the aggregated land cover types called for in lines 28 to 35 be archived (but not in this variable).  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice). Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Omon.intppdiat

Field 11: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Field 12: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom phytoplankton component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: Omon.nh4os
Field 12: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: EmonZ.utendepfd
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to Eliassen-Palm Flux Divergence
Field 11: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to Eliassen-Palm Flux Divergence
Field 12: Tendency of the zonal mean zonal wind due to the divergence of the Eliassen-Palm flux.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Atmospheric Zonal Mean (on 39 pressure levels) [Y-P39] [tmean]

Name: Emon.mrsosLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column of Land-Use Tile
Field 11: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column of Land-Use Tile
Field 12: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface layer; integrate over uppermost 10cm

Name: Omon.sf6
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6. [Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: IyrGre.sftgrf
Field 12: This is needed in case the grounded ice sheet area changes in time (NO floating ice shelf)
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [am-tm]

Name: AERmon.rsutaf
Field 12: Flux corresponding to rsut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

Name: Lmon.c4PftFrac
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type
Field 11: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type
Field 12: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops). [Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]

Name: CFsubhr.psl
Field 12: not, in general, the same as surface pressure [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: Oday.vo
Field 12: na

Name: IyrGre.modelCellAreai
Title (from Variables (Import)): The Cell Area of the Ice Sheet Model
Field 11: The Cell Area of the Ice Sheet Model
Field 12: When interpolated to a regular grid, it should be interpolated (not summed) with a conservative scheme to preserve total area
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [am-tm]

Name: CFday.ps
Field 12: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

Name: AERmon.mmrss
Field 12: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of sea salt aerosol (dry mass).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: AERmon.ttop
Field 12: cloud_top refers to the top of the highest cloud. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

Name: Emon.expn
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.bfe
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Ofx.hfgeou
Title (from Variables (Import)): Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Field 11: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Field 12: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor [If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon fields (see the Omon table)]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amns-fx]

Name: Omon.ocfriver
Title (from Variables (Import)): Flux of Organic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
Field 11: Flux of Organic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
Field 12: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

Name: Emon.rsdscsdiff
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
Field 11: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
Field 12: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions

Name: Omon.phymiscos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Field 12: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

Name: ImonAnt.rsus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Antarctic Polar Stereographic Grid [XYA-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: IyrGre.xvelbase
Title (from Variables (Import)): X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Field 11: X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Field 12: A velocity is a vector quantity. 'x' indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. 'Land ice' means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. 'basal' means the lower boundary of the land ice.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Greenland Polar Stereographic Grid [XYG-na] [amni-twmn]

Name: CFmon.tnt
Field 12: Tendency of Air Temperature
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: CFsubhr.rlucs
Field 12: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA) [Report on model half-levels (i.e., interfaces between model layers).]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles (half levels) at specified sites [S-AH] [tpt]

Name: Omon.thetao
Field 12: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field. [Note change from CMIP5 K to CMIP6 C. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.ppdiaz
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Field 11: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Field 12: Primary (organic carbon) production by the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.phabio
Field 12: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (abiotic component).. [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.fNleach
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)
Field 11: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Leaching' means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, 'runoff' refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.

Name: Emon.fVegFire
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

Name: Amon.fco2antt
Title (from Variables (Import)): Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

Name: CF3hr.rsds
Field 12: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amn-tpt]

Name: Omon.chldiazos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Field 12: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Name: Efx.vegHeight
Field 12: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level) [XY-na] [amla]

Name: Odec.sosga
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Name: Emon.snowmxrat
Field 12: na

Name: AERmon.rlscsaf
Field 12: na

Name: Oday.thetao
Field 12: na

Name: Eday.rls
Field 12: Net longwave radiation

Name: day.tasmin
Field 12: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min') [normally report this at 2 meters above the surface]

Name: Omon.co3natos
Field 12: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the natural-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

Name: Emon.vqint
Field 12: Northward integrated moisture transport

Name: 6hrPlevPt.snowmxrat
Field 12: na

Field 12: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the 'thickness' diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called 'ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity'.  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant. [3-d time dependent field]
Field 13: Climatological mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [aclim]

Name: Omon.arag

Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Field 11: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Emon.fNgas
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
Field 11: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
Field 12: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

Field 12: Gas exchange flux of abiotic CO2 (positive into ocean)

Name: Lmon.gwt
Field 12: na

Name: Omon.limnmisc
Field 12: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Miscellaneous phytoplankton' are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: Eday.mrsow
Field 12: relative_soil_moisture_content_above_field_capacity

Name: Omon.phycos
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations.  In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., 'Diatom Carbon Concentration' and 'Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration'

Name: Omon.fg14co2abio
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)

Name: Omon.o2min
Field 12: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean.  A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole_concentration_of_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Field 11: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

Name: Amon.rsut

Field 12: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. Field 12: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: day.sfcWind

Name: Emon.v2

Name: Odec.tosga

Field 13: Time Invariant Global Field on Soil Levels [XY-na] {sdepth:} [amla]

Name: AERmon.nh50

Name: CFsubhr.evu

Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Field 12: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

If spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Total Atmospheric Mass of CO2 (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (19 pressure levels) [XY-P19] [tmean]

Name: Eyr.vegFrac

A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]

See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]

Name: CFday.ccb
Title (from Variables (Import)): Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Field 11: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Field 12: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Name: Emon.fProductDecompLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Carbon Mass Flux from Wood and Agricultural Product Pools on Land Use Tile into Atmosphere [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Carbon Mass Flux from Wood and Agricultural Product Pools on Land Use Tile into Atmosphere [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of 'forestry and agricultural products' are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites. Produce this variable i  a model has explicit anthropogenic product pools by land use tile

Name: AERmon.reffclwtop
Field 12: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius ''as seen from space'' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Name: Emon.nppLut
Title (from Variables (Import)): Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: 'Production of carbon' means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ('producers'), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. 'Productivity' means production per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

Name: Eday.snrefr
Title (from Variables (Import)): Refreezing of Water in the Snow
Field 11: Refreezing of Water in the Snow
Field 12: surface_snow_and_ice_refreezing_flux

Name: Omon.nh4
Field 12: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oyr.ocontemppsmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Field 12: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field. [Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.msftmrho
Field 12: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized. [Function of latitude, rho, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction" (msftyrho), which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Meridional Section (on density surfaces) [YB-R] [bzzsum]

Name: Emon.osaltrmadvect
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Field 12: The phrase 'residual mean advection' refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Oclim.difvmto
Title (from Variables (Import)): Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity Due to Tides
Field 11: Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity Due to Tides
Field 12: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. The construction vertical_X_diffusivity means the vertical component of the diffusivity of X due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model. 'Due to tides' means due to all astronomical gravity changes which manifest as tides. No distinction is made between different tidal components. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.

Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).]
