Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. [at 100 m depth.]

Name: CFsubhr.rldscs
Field 12: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: AERmon.o3

Name: EmonZ.tntc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection

Field 12: zonal mean; hence YZT

Name: CFsubhr.rlus
Field 12: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. [This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.]
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Site (121 specified sites) [S-na] [apt-tpt]

Name: LImon.snd
Field 12: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

Name: Omon.hfbasinpmdiff
Title (from Variables (Import)): Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Field 11: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Field 12: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin. [For models which do not have a Cartesian lat-long grid, this transport can be approximated as thetransport across zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate tothe model's resolution, as is done for the ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Ocean Basin Zonal Sum [YB-na] [bzzsum]

Name: Amon.ccb
Title (from Variables (Import)): Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Field 11: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Field 12: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Name: day.vas
Field 12: Northward component of the near surface wind [normally, report this at 10 meters above the surface]

Name: Eday.hus850
Field 12: Specific Humidity

Name: AERmon.od550ss
Field 12: Total aerosol AOD due to sea salt aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: Emon.raRoot
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 11: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

Name: day.evspsbl
Field 12: na

Name: Emon.sfcWindmax
Field 12: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.
Field 13: Mean Daily Maximum, Global field (single level) [XY-na] {:height10m} [dmax]

Name: Emon.nLeaf
Field 12: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area.

Name: Omon.phnat
Field 12: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (natural component). [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: E3hrPt.jpdftaureliqmodis
Title (from Variables (Import)): MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Field 11: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Field 12: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, liquid
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Global field, single level [XY-na] {effectRadLi tau:} [amn-tpt]

Name: Emon.rainmxrat
Field 12: na

Name: day.zg
Field 12: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (8 pressure levels) [XY-P8] [tmean]

Name: SIday.sisnthick
Field 12: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)

Name: Emon.parasolRefl
Field 12: PARASOL Reflectance

Name: Omon.sossq
Field 12: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.  [Report on native horizontal grid.]

Name: E3hr.uas
Field 12: Near surface eastward wind component

Name: Omon.expc
Title (from Variables (Import)): Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Field 11: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Field 12: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon [Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: day.rss
Field 12: Net shortwave radiation

Name: Oyr.difvho
Field 12: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field. [Report on native horizontal grid as well. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.phyfeos
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 11: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations

Name: Emon.clwmodis
Field 12: MODIS Liquid Cloud Fraction

Name: Omon.bacc
Field 12: sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.po4os
Title (from Variables (Import)): Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration
Field 11: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration
Field 12: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. 'Dissolved inorganic phosphorus' means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).

Name: Lmon.fVegLitter
Title (from Variables (Import)): Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Field 11: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.

Name: LImon.agesno
Field 12: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as 'missing in regions free of snow on land.

Name: Emon.swtoacsdust
Title (from Variables (Import)): Clear Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Dust at Toa
Field 11: Clear Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Dust at Toa
Field 12: Instantaneous forcing is the radiative flux change caused instantaneously by an imposed change in radiative forcing agent (greenhouse gases, aerosol, solar radiation, etc.).

Name: Emon.wetlandCH4cons
Title (from Variables (Import)): Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
Field 11: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
Field 12: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Name: CFsubhr.tnta
Title (from Variables (Import)): Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
Field 11: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
Field 12: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection
Field 13: Instantaneous value (i.e. synoptic or time-step value), Atmospheric profiles at specified sites [S-A] [tpt]

Name: Omon.hfx
Field 12: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.  Use Celsius for temperature scale. [2d field for CMIP6. Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.]

Name: Omon.pon
Title (from Variables (Import)): Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 11: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Field 12: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations [Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]

Name: AERmon.mmrsoa
Title (from Variables (Import)): Secondary Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Field 11: Secondary Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Field 12: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of secondary organic aerosols (particulate organic matter formed within the atmosphere from gaseous precursors; dry mass).
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: fx.sftlf
Title (from Variables (Import)): Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)
Field 11: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)
Field 12: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land. [For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.]
Field 13: No temporal dimensions ... fixed field, Global field (single level) [XY-na]

Name: LImon.snmIs
Field 12: Loss of snow mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the surface melt water from snow on the ice sheet portion of the grid cell divided by the ice_sheet area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land_ice regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

Name: day.rsds
Field 12: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

Name: AERmon.hcho
Field 12: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field on model atmosphere levels [XY-A]

Name: Omon.intpbp
Field 12: Vertically integrated biogenic phosphorus production
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global field (sum over depth) [XY-na] [amdss-tmn]

Name: Omon.hfsnthermds
Title (from Variables (Import)): Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics
Field 11: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics
Field 12: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'Snow thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion. [In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Name: Omon.tob
Title (from Variables (Import)): Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor

"Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.]
Field 13: Temporal mean, Global ocean field on model levels [XY-O] [tmean]

Field 11: Aerosol Level Single Scattering Albedo for Each Band
Field 12: The single scattering albedo is the fraction of radiation in an incident light beam scattered by the particles of an aerosol reference volume for a given wavelength. It is the ratio of the scattering and the extinction coefficients of the aerosol particles in the reference volume.

Name: Emon.fProductDecomp

Field 11: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Field 12: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of 'forestry and agricultural products' are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'.
